name: Lemon Velvet Sheet Cake
author: Jessie Sheehan
summary: A moist lemon cake with a lemon sugar glaze that shatters with every bite. The cake is super moist and will keep tightly covered at room temperature for 3 to 5 days.
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Spray a 9x13x2-inch baking pan with cooking spray
Line the bottom with parchment paper
Whisk cake flour, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda together in a medium bowl and set aside
Combine white sugar and lemon zest in a large mixing bowl
Use your fingers to rub the zest into the sugar until fully incorporated
Whisk in olive oil, lemon extract, and vanilla extract
Add eggs and egg yolks, 1 at a time, whisking vigorously between each addition
Add lemon juice and whisk again; add creme fraiche, whisking a final time to incorporate
Add the flour mixture to the sugar mixture all at once and use a rubber spatula to very gently fold the dry into the wet
Transfer the batter to the prepared pan
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out mostly clean with a crumb or two, rotating at the halfway point, 30 to 33 minutes
Set on a cooling rack and let the cake cool for 10 to 15 minutes
Invert the cake, right-side up, on to the rack, and set over a rimmed baking sheet
While cake cools, make the glaze
Place confectioners' sugar and lemon juice in a large bowl
Gently pour over the cake, using an offset spatula to spread the glaze if it pools, and let the cake cool to room temperature
You can poke the cake with a toothpick to help the glaze seep in
